qjs: Run JavaScript in Go ‚Äî A new Cgo-free runtime option to integrate JavaScript into Go apps. Rather than bind to a native library, it uses a fork of QuickJS compiled to WebAssembly and then run under Wazero. You get ES2023 compatibility, sandboxing, zero-copy sharing of values between Go and JS, and the ability to expose Go functions to JS and vice¬†versa.

Nguyen Ngoc Phuong and Contributors

Tuple - The Fastest Way to Review AI Slop ‚Äî Wasting hours debugging AI code? Tuple brings your team together in seconds to figure it out, clean it up, and¬†ship.

item.title: „ÄêGo 1.25's flight recorder„ÄëGo 1.25ÁöÑÈ£ûË°åËÆ∞ÂΩï‰ª™
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã572 ‚Äî October 1, 2025

Read the Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Flight Recorder in Go 1.25 ‚Äî Billed as ‚Äúa powerful new tool in the Go diagnostics toolbox‚Äù, the ‚Äòflight recorder‚Äô continuously collects execution traces and buffers the past few seconds, letting you capture exactly the window of time needed to diagnose a problem after it‚Äôs already¬†happened.

Carlos Amedee and Michael Knyszek

Cloud Infrastructure: Startup to¬†Scale ‚Äî Deploy and scale apps with containers, Supabase, AWS, Terraform, and CI/CD pipelines. Go from startup speed to enterprise-grade reliability through the three phases of growth: Startup, Growth, and¬†Scale.

Frontend Masters sponsor

Accepted! Go Proposals Distilled ‚Äî A new series of blog posts covering accepted Go language proposals ‚Äî so you can get up to speed with things coming to future versions of Go without having to read the entire proposal. So far Anton has covered maphash.Hasher and new(expr).

Anton Zhiyanov

IN BRIEF:

  • The Traefik project celebrates its tenth anniversary with a look at how it's matured, grown, and become one of the best known Go-powered infrastructure tools.

  • JetBrains offers a preview of its new Islands theme coming to its IDEs, including GoLand ‚Äì you can try it now, however.

üìä¬†'We Tried Go's Experimental Green Tea Garbage Collector and It Didn't Help Performance' ‚Äî For Dolt‚Äôs use case (which is quite specific), the experimental ‚ÄòGreen Tea‚Äô garbage collector you can opt to use in Go 1.25 provided no real benefits, but your mileage may vary so it‚Äôs worth trying¬†out.

Zach Mushrave (Dolt)

Starving, Sleeping, and Yielding: Understanding Go's Scheduler ‚Äî ‚ÄúWriting concurrent programs in Go is easy, but understanding the behaviour (or, more frequently, misbehaviour) of those programs is another¬†matter.‚Äù

John Arundel

3 Critical TTL Patterns for In-Memory Caching ‚Äî Leaning on the author‚Äôs own Hot library that provides fast in-memory caching for Go¬†apps.

Samuel Berthe

‚ö° Supercharge Postgres: 2PB Scale & 1.5t Metrics/Day ‚Äî TigerData makes Postgres the fastest database for modern workloads: 2PB scale, 1.5T metrics/day, no black¬†boxes.

TigerData sponsor

üì∫ OpenCV for Go and WebAssembly with Ron Evans ‚Äì A live 90-minute session about computer vision with Ron Evans (of TinyGo and GoCV¬†fame). OpenCV Live

üìÑ The new() Function Will Take an Expression in Go¬†1.26 Chris Siebenmann

üìÑ Build a Water Simulation in Go with raylib-go Tim Little

üìÑ Register Allocation in the Go Compiler Vladimir Makarov

üìÑ Slice Tails Don't Grow Forever Ted Unangst

üõ† Code & Tools

Do 2.0: Type-Safe Dependency Injection Toolkit ‚Äî A library that provides the dependency injection design pattern and uses generics instead of reflection in order to provide a type-safe API. If you‚Äôre already a Do user, there‚Äôs a guide for upgrading from v1.x to v2.0 to follow. GitHub¬†repo.

Samuel Berthe

Failsafe: Fault Tolerance, Resilience Patterns & Policies ‚Äî A library for building fault-tolerant apps where you can wrap code in various resilience policies such as Retry, CircuitBreaker, RateLimiter, Timeout, and Fallback. Releases in recent weeks add several new features including usage tracking (to enforce fairness) and execution budgets for setting a maximum ‚Äòbudget‚Äô for retries or hedges across a¬†system.

Jonathan Halterman

üì∞¬†Classifieds

üçê Tuple - how developers at Shopify, Figma, and Stripe collaborate on code. Stop dictating and take control with¬†Tuple.

PegoMock 4.3: A Powerful Yet Simple Mocking Framework ‚Äî Brings an easy-to-read DSL to mocking. You can do stubbing and argument matching, as¬†well.

Peter G√∂tz

eBPF Web Fingerprint: Library and Server for TCP and TLS¬†Fingerprinting
Alberto Ventafridda

  • ü©ª dicom 1.1 ‚Äì DICOM medical image parsing library and CLI¬†tool.

  • Open Policy Agent (OPA) 1.9 ‚Äì General-purpose policy engine.

  • MCP-Go 0.41 ‚Äì An implementation of the Model Context Protocol¬†(MCP) for integrating with AI¬†apps.

  • Fiber 3.0.0 RC2 ‚Äì Express.js-inspired Web framework for¬†Go.

  • Shiori 1.8 ‚Äì Simple bookmark manager app.

item.title: „ÄêThe talks from GopherCon UK 2025 go live„ÄëGopherCon UK 2025 ÁöÑÊºîËÆ≤‰∏äÁ∫ø
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã571 ‚Äî September 24, 2025

Read the Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Go's Support for Valgrind Instrumentation ‚Äî Valgrind is a commonly used instrumentation framework for creating tools that can do profiling and detect various memory management and threading bugs in apps. This still-experimental support for Valgrind in Go opens up a wealth of extra opportunities for low-level diagnostics for Go¬†programs.

Roland Shoemaker

üí° This Hacker News discussion has more details, including a comment from the author of the pull request/CL about what the support was initially intended¬†for.

Go Event-Driven: From the Watermill Creators ‚Äî Mi≈Çosz and Robert from Three Dots Labs are launching the next edition of their hands-on training. It teaches the tricky parts of event-driven systems such as the outbox pattern, message ordering, and sagas. Don't sleep on this one. Opens autumn¬†2025.

Three Dots Labs sponsor

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Twenty Talks from GopherCon UK 2025 ‚Äî A YouTube playlist containing the just-uploaded talks from last month‚Äôs London-based Go conference. Every talk is technical and deep, but you might particularly enjoy Daniel Marti‚Äôs What‚Äôs Coming in Go 1.25, Roland Shoemaker talking about Go security, or Emily Achieng talking about Go module hygiene and keeping your go.sum and go.mod files in¬†check.

GopherCon UK

Practical Networking Patterns in Go ‚Äî A new section of the on-going ‚ÄúGo Optimization Guide‚Äù featuring 13 guides to the various topics involved in building scalable, networked Go apps ‚Äî including benchmarking, how to achieve ‚Äòmassive concurrency‚Äô, diagnostics, transport protocols, low-level tuning, and¬†more.

Alexander Stavonin

IN BRIEF:

  • The latest Go developer survey is open for just one more week, closing next Tuesday, September 30. You can take it here.

  • WebAssembly/WASM is an increasingly common compilation target for Go, so it's neat to see the WebAssembly 3.0 standard is now 'live' (and already ships with most browsers) with various features that should improve interoperability in the long-term, including garbage collection, tail calls, and exception handling.

  • The IEEE has published a list of the top 'programming languages' in 2025 with Go coming in at number¬†10.

Building Conway‚Äôs Game of Life with raylib-go ‚Äî Just a bit of fun. Here‚Äôs the resulting¬†code.

Tim Little

Kubernetes CPU Limits and Go ‚Äî An update of an article from 2024. Go‚Äôs runtime doesn‚Äôt inherently know that it‚Äôs running within a Kubernetes environment, so there are tweaks you can make. However, also bear in mind Go 1.25‚Äôs changes to GOMAXPROCS‚Äôs¬†defaults.

William Kennedy

üìÑ How Fast is Go? Simulating Millions of Particles on a Smart TV ‚Äì ‚ÄúGo is able to simulate 2.5 million particles at 60 fps while sending data at 30 fps to in theory over 300 clients, maybe even a¬†thousand.‚Äù David Gerrells

üìÑ Making a Cross-Platform Game using Pion and WebRTC Datachannels ‚Äì The current setup has some drawbacks, but there‚Äôs a lot of potential here if you want to explore¬†it. Srayan Jana

üìÑ CSRF Protection via Headers in Go 1.25 Jon Calhoun

üõ† Code & Tools

ü§ñ¬†GoMLX: An Accelerated Machine Learning Framework for Go ‚Äî A set of machine learning libraries and tools designed to act as a sort-of Go alternative to PyTorch or TensorFlow. Despite the name, it‚Äôs not related to Apple‚Äôs MLX framework and is actually Linux-only for now. It does, however, open up the opportunity to train and use ML models directly from Go, as Eli Bendersky explains in this introductory¬†post.

GoMLX Team

TableWriter 1.1: Render Rich Text-Based Tables ‚Äî A flexible library for rendering tabular data to ASCII, Unicode, Markdown, HTML, or for colorized terminals. The README is packed with¬†examples.

Oleku Konko

Secure Your Agentic Apps with Auth for GenAI ‚Äî Secure your agentic apps with features like User Authentication for AI agents, Token Vault, and more with Auth0‚Äôs Auth for GenAI (exclusively in Developer¬†Preview).

Auth0 sponsor

Gojekyll: A Fast Go Implementation of Jekyll ‚Äî Jekyll is a very popular Ruby-powered static site generator ‚Äì this is a ‚Äòpartially-compatible‚Äô clone that boasts enhanced performance and portability by being written in¬†Go. Worth a look if you have a Jekyll-powered site but want to remove Ruby from your¬†stack.

Oliver Steele and Daniil Gentili

Valgo 0.7: An Expressive Validator Library ‚Äî Type-safe and extensible validator library built upon generics. Rules are written in functions and not in struct tags. v0.7 adds new validation helpers and type-safe validators that remove codegen and width-specific¬†types.

Cohesive Stack

Fibratus: Windows Kernel Exploration and Observability Tool ‚Äî Now pitched as a ‚Äúadversary tradecraft detection, protection, and hunting‚Äù tool, Fibratus captures system events, such as file I/O and network requests, and scans memory, so you can gain insight into what apps are up to. GitHub¬†repo.

Fibratus

Go Allocations Explorer Extension for VSCode ‚Äî Uses your benchmarks to identify and list the allocations inside VS¬†Code.

Matt Sherman

  • purego 0.9 ‚Äì Library for calling C functions from Go without Cgo, now with support for Objective-C blocks and linux/loong64.

  • k6 1.3 ‚Äì Modern Go + JavaScript-powered load testing tool.¬†(Homepage.)

  • MCP-Go 0.40 ‚Äì An implementation of the Model Context Protocol¬†(MCP).

  • NATS.go 1.46 ‚Äì Go client for the NATS messaging¬†system.

  • BillionMail 4.5 ‚Äì Go-powered email campaign¬†platform.

  • golangci-lint 2.5 ‚Äì A faster way to run Go¬†linters.

  • go-github 75.0 ‚Äì GitHub v3 API client¬†library.

  • Gin 1.11 ‚Äì Popular HTTP web¬†framework.

item.title: „ÄêThe latest Go developer survey is open„ÄëÊúÄÊñ∞ÁöÑ Go ÂºÄÂèëËÄÖË∞ÉÊü•Â∑≤ÂºÄÊîæ
item.description:
„Äê

#‚Äã570 ‚Äî September 17, 2025

Read the Web¬†Version

Go Weekly

Memory Allocation in Go ‚Äî The efficient allocation and management of memory is a fundamental part of what makes Go programs reliable and responsive and, luckily, Go abstracts away most of the complexity. If you want to know what‚Äôs going on under the hood, though, this is a fantastic, rich, diagrammed¬†exploration.

Nghia Nguyen

Go Beyond with Frontend and Fullstack Engineering Courses ‚Äî Get $100 off an annual Frontend Masters membership, and gain access to professional courses on Go, TypeScript, Cloud Infrastructure, AWS, React, and much much more. Sale ends soon¬†‚Üí

Frontend Masters sponsor

It's Survey Time! The 2025 Go Developer Survey is Live ‚Äî Every now and then the Go team seeks input from the community to know what to focus on next. The deadline this time is quite short with the survey closing on September 30, so check it out¬†now.

Todd Kulesza and the Go team

IN BRIEF:

  • Next week (Sep 22-26) is one of Go's 'quiet weeks', a period where the Go team largely goes silent, takes a break, or focuses on deep work without¬†interruption. Not a good week for any new language proposals!

  • GitHub's Dependabot now supports Go modules hosted on private registries. Blake Gentry explains more, including why this matters.

GopherCon 2025 Go Contributor Summit Notes ‚Äî Numerous Go contributors came together at the recent GopherCon event to discuss issues including dependency management, the language proposal process, cgo performance, WebAuthn, fuzzing and coverage, WebAssembly as a target (and even the JVM-briefly!), and more. The notes are rough, but flesh out the thinking in many¬†areas.

Google Docs

The Day the Linter Broke My Code ‚Äî Linters don‚Äôt always have all the context when they identify an issue, resulting in cases where an innocuous fix can break your code, forcing you to.. lint your¬†linter?

Oliver Eikemeier

Product for Engineers Newsletter ‚Äî Build better products, not just better code. Learn how to build features users love. Subscribe for¬†free.

PostHog sponsor

üìÑ Using Go Channels to Solve Interface Impedance Mismatch ‚Äì ‚Äúone of the few times in years of Go development that I‚Äôve used channels ‚Ä¶ for a non-concurrent use¬†case‚Äù Zach Musgrave

üìÑ How to Implement the Outbox Pattern in Go and Postgres ‚Äì A resilient way to ensure messages get to where they‚Äôre meant¬†to. Alex Pliutau

üìÑ Building a Simple Stack-Based Virtual Machine in Go ‚Äì Here‚Äôs the¬†code. Phakorn Kiong

üìÑ Observe Live SQL Queries in Go with DTrace Philippe Gaultier

üõ† Code & Tools

Flaggy 1.6: Idiomatic Go Command Line Input Parsing ‚Äî Supports subcommands, positional values, and flags at any position. No external dependencies and doesn‚Äôt insist on a particular project or package layout. v1.6 adds built-in bash/zsh completion generators and drops support for comma separated multi-value¬†arguments.

Eric Greer

graphics.gd: Use Go with the Godot Game Engine ‚Äî Godot is a popular engine for both 2D and 3D games and, despite the name, isn‚Äôt related to Go. This project, however, offers a Go runtime and tooling layer on top of Godot and it can now even be used to create iOS apps in¬†Go.

Quentin Quaadgras

koanf 2.3: Read Configuration with Multiple Sources and Formats ‚Äî Support for JSON, TOML, YAML, environment variables, command line, file, S3 etc. A ‚Äòlighter‚Äô alternative to¬†Viper.

Kailash Nadh

  • Google Gen AI Go SDK v1.25.0 ‚Äì Go SDK for integrating Google's generative AI models including Gemini and Vertex AI into applications.

  • FastHTTP 1.66 ‚Äì Performance-oriented alternative to net/http for specific high-volume¬†scenarios.

  • PSQL Wire Protocol v0.15.0 ‚Äì Pure Go implementation of the Postgres server wire protocol for building custom servers.

  • easyjson 0.9.1 ‚Äì Marshal/unmarshal structs to/from JSON sans¬†reflection.

  • OpenFGA 1.10 ‚Äì Google Zanzibar-inspired authorization¬†engine.

  • River 0.25 ‚Äì Robust job processing system for Go and¬†Postgres.

  • Hugo 0.150.0 ‚Äì The popular static site¬†generator.

  • Goyave 5.9 ‚Äì Opinionated REST API framework.

üì∞¬†Classifieds

Go beyond caching. Redis 8.2 handles 5x more data with 150 new commands and 8 new data structures vs 7.2. Get started¬†today.

üí¨ A Blast from the Past

Retro AIM Server: A Way to Get AIM and ICQ Working Again? ‚Äî A curious Go-powered project that provides a self-hosted instant messaging server that classic AOL Instant Messenger and ICQ clients can¬†use. Why? Why¬†not?
